D-RANK

Mission 05: Evidence & Claims

Analyze Informational Text to Support Claims

[SYSTEM NOTIFICATION]
A Literary Gate has been detected. Difficulty: D-Rank.
Hunter Hyro, master the skill of finding evidence in informational texts to support claims.

The Challenge Awaits

Informational texts are filled with facts and evidence that can be used to support claims. Like gathering intelligence before a raid, you must learn to extract key information and connect it to arguments.

Your mission? Read about George Washington Carver and analyze how the text provides evidence to support various claims about his life and achievements.

Hunter Equipment

  • Pencil and highlighter
  • Evidence tracking chart
  • Note-taking paper

Skills to Unlock

Power Standard PS5
The student will analyze informational text to support evidence of claims.

Dungeon Raid

Official Quest Instructions

Students will independently read the informational text about George Washington Carver. After which they will complete questions demonstrating their ability to find and use text evidence to support claims.

Your Quest Materials

George Washington Carver - Read this informational text Text Questions - Complete these questions

Raid Strategy Guide

Step 1: Preview and Read

Read the text about George Washington Carver. Note key facts, dates, and achievements as you read.

Step 2: Identify Claims

Look for statements that can be proved using information from the text. Claims are assertions that need evidence to be believed.

Step 3: Find Supporting Evidence

For each claim, find specific quotes, facts, or details from the text that prove it's true. Use exact wording when possible.

Step 4: Connect Evidence to Claims

Explain HOW the evidence supports the claim. Don't just quote - explain the connection.

Step 5: Complete Questions

Answer all questions, using direct quotes and specific details from the text as evidence.

Claude Code Training

[TRAINING PROTOCOL ACTIVATED]
Before attempting the assignment, you must train with your AI companion. Claude will guide you through the concepts and verify your understanding.

Step 1: Open Your Terminal

Open a terminal on your computer and run this command to start Claude Code:

claude --dangerously-skip-permissions

Step 2: Summon Your Guide

Copy and paste this prompt to begin your training:

Hey Claude, I'm Hunter Hyro on LA Mission 05 about finding text evidence.
I need to master using evidence before my George Washington Carver assignment.

Be my training guide and:
1. Explain what counts as strong text evidence (quotes vs paraphrasing)
2. Show me how to connect evidence to claims with explanation
3. Give me 3 practice problems where I find evidence for given claims
4. Quiz me: give me a claim and a passage - I'll find and explain the evidence
5. Have me explain the difference between just quoting and actually connecting evidence to a claim

Only tell me "Quest Unlocked" when I truly understand. Don't let me skip ahead!
Start by explaining why direct quotes are powerful evidence.

Step 3: Complete Your Training

Work through all phases with Claude:

  • Phase 1: Learn the concept (Claude explains)
  • Phase 2: Answer checkpoint questions
  • Phase 3: Complete 3 skill trials
  • Phase 4: Pass the Boss Challenge
  • Phase 5: Teach the concept back to Claude

You cannot proceed until Claude says "Quest Unlocked"!

Guild Master Verification

STOP! Summon your Guild Master (Parent/Guardian) for verification.

  • [ ] Read the entire informational text
  • [ ] Claims are identified correctly
  • [ ] Evidence is quoted directly from text
  • [ ] Connection between evidence and claims is explained
  • [ ] All questions are complete

Quest Completion

Congratulations, Hunter!

You have cleared the D-Rank Literary Gate: Evidence & Claims.

Upload your completed Text Questions worksheet to Boost.

Reward: +2 Reading Power | Text Evidence Skill Unlocked
